goal: Fix TypeScript validator to detect arrow functions in class properties and object properties
description: The TypeScript validator's _extract_arrow_functions() method only detects arrow functions assigned to variables (const/let declarations), but misses arrow functions defined as class properties (e.g., handleClick = (e) => {}) and object properties (e.g., { onClick: (e) => {} }). This causes validation failures in React components and other codebases that use these common patterns. The fix enhances _extract_arrow_functions() to detect these additional patterns using tree-sitter node types: public_field_definition (class properties) and pair (object properties).
